attributes.name: attributes
attributes.comment:
Map of request attributes.

Attributes are objects that can be shared between interceptors and routes

body.name: body
body.comment:
The request body.

redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.body can be a dart-core.Map, dart-core.List or dart-core.String. See redstone/redstone_server.HttpBody for more information.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

method.name: method
method.comment: The method, such as 'GET' or 'POST', for the request (read-only).

queryParams.name: queryParams
queryParams.comment: The query parameters associated with the request

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

url.name: url
url.comment:
The remainder of the redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.requestedUri path and query designating the virtual "location" of the request's target within the handler.

redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.url may be an empty, if redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.requestedUritargets the handler root and does not have a trailing slash.

redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.url is never null. If it is not empty, it will start with /.

scriptName and redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.url combine to create a valid path that should correspond to the redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.requestedUri path.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of redstone/redstone_mocks.RequestHandler.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
